alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Clay (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued November 19 at 3:03PM EST until November 21 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...Fire Weather Watch in effect from Monday morning until Tuesday morning... .Gusty south to southeast winds are exepcted to develop across the mountains of East Tennessee and southwest North Carolina on Monday, and continue through Tuesday morning. With the recent dry conditions, these winds may cause extreme fire behavior and allow fires to spread rapidly. Rain is expected to spread into the area Tuesday morning. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA... The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Monday morning through Tuesday morning. * TIMING...8 AM EST Monday through 8 AM EST Tuesday. * WIND...South to southeast winds gusting between 25 and 40 mph on Monday, then gusts increasing to between 40 and 60 mph Monday night. Up to 70 mph gusts possible in some locations. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are possible. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
